content.description: Located to the right of Every Day is Earth Day,  Climb incipient seams to plates.  Rappel from anchors at the top of Every Day is Earth Day.
content.protection: No bolts. No fixed gear. If you can't figure out what you need by looking up at this route, you probably should find something else to climb. Seriously.
content.location: South-facing side of Earth Day Dome. Good for those cold windy winter days.

content.description:
Previously described in the comments of neighboring route

Choss Whisperer

, this short left angling crack was named by Munge Climber.

The route is extremely chossy at the start with shallow crack, which does accept good pro starting about 12' up.  The pro is actually pretty solid, which is thankful as the rock is not.   Barely worth doing if in the area.  The crack peters out on a gravely low angle shelf which you can climb right to tie into the mussy hook anchor of "Choss Whisperer".
content.protection: Pro to 3", nuts are a good choice too.  Mussy Hooks for anchor, sharing with Choss Whisperer.
content.location: West facing, right of the large crack splitting the Munge Dome.  Directly left of Choss Whisperer which is the only (at time of entry) bolted line on the face (with 7 bolts).

content.description: Climb grainy friction up through Earth Day Dome's "smile"
content.location:
The route is visible from the cattle gate east of the candy store. It is the leftmost bolted route on the west face of Earth Day Dome.

To descend, rap from anchors at the top.

content.description: Wander up the hollow, friable, crumbly, poorly-protected face to the right of Have a Slabulous Day. The first reliable protection is a slung horn about 70 feet off the deck.
content.protection: one each 0.5 and 0.75 camalots, one shoulder-length runner, and don't fall.
content.location:
Located on Earth Day Dome between have a Slabulous Day and Every Day is Earth Day, a gear-only route up detached flakes and crumbly rock.

For extra credit, belay at the top anchored only to a partially detached horn shaped like a large, old-style telephone handset. Otherwise, use either of the bolted anchors atop the neighboring routes, and rap from these anchors as well.

content.description: Face climb past 5 bolts to a bolted anchor at the summit. It is also possible to sling a horn about 70 feet up by wandering to the left onto Have a Scabulous Day
content.location: Located on the right shoulder of the West Face of Earth Day Dome.  Rappel from a bolted anchor at the top.

climbs.name: Corner the Market, Lose the Planet

content.description:
Don't be fooled by the 3-star rating in the guidebook, this thing is some "grade A" choss wrangling.

Boulder up past 1 bolt on decomposing flakes to access what appears from the ground to be a nice handcrack in a corner. Make the discovery that it's in fact a thin, shallow, flaring, grainy slot and then commit to crumbling edges on the face to the right. Whine, whimper, curse, and pray your way up the corner to where you can make a couple of grainy friction moves out right to a thank-god bolt. One more committing face move gets you to lower-angled terrain and the anchor.

It's probably best for your belayer to stand a little off to the side to avoid the inevitable rain of grain that will be coming off, and in the event that you blow it and rip all of your marginal gear, someone will still be alive to go get the coroner.

Kind of "fun" in a sick and twisted way, this might eventually clean up with another 100 ascents or so.
content.protection: 2 Bolts, Gear to 2 inches. Fixed anchor at top.
content.location: Located down a corridor immediately east of Earthday Dome, walk past the route "Greenpeace and Greenbacks" and just keep going. Look on the right for a dihedral with 1 bolt at the bottom. Lower or rappel off of fixed cold shuts.

content.description: A crumbly start leads to better rock above, with a fun exit. Like many new routes in the Alabama Hills, be aware of loose holds and friable rock until the route sees more traffic.
content.location:
Located on the west face of Munge Dome.

Descent: Rappel from Mussy Hooks at the top.
